net.hudup.core

Class Firer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.Firer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PluginManager

    public class Firer
extends java.lang.Object
implements PluginManager
    This class is the full implementation of PluginManager. At the booting time, Hudup framework creates an Firer object to initialize important system information. Actually, the constructor of Firer calls its method fire() to initialize important system information. In current implementation, there are two important tasks of method fire() as follows:
    1. Method fire() creates default directories such as working directory and directory of knowledge base.
    2. Method fire() continues to call method discover(String...) to discover and register all algorithms (from class path and libaray of Hudup framework) into PluginStorage.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Method Detail

      • fire

        public void fire()
        Description copied from interface: PluginManager
        This is the first method which needs to be called firstly for any Hudup application. This method is called one time at boot time for any Hudup application. In current implementation, there are two important tasks of fire method as follows:
        1. Create default directories such as working directory and directory of knowledge base.
        2. Call method PluginManager.discover() to discover and register all algorithms (from class path and libaray of Hudup framework) into PluginStorage.
        Specified by:
        fire in interface PluginManager

      • isFired

        public boolean isFired()
        Description copied from interface: PluginManager
        Testing whether PluginManager.fire() method was fired.
        Specified by:
        isFired in interface PluginManager
        Returns:
        whether PluginManager.fire() method was fired.

      • discover

        public void discover()
        Description copied from interface: PluginManager
        This method discovers automatically all algorithms via their names, which initializes and updates plug-in storage PluginStorage. Packages are specified in Hudup property file. If these packages are not specified, all packages are browsed.
        Specified by:
        discover in interface PluginManager

      • discover

        public <T> java.util.List<T> discover(java.lang.Class<T> referredClass)
        Description copied from interface: PluginManager
        Getting a list of instances belonging referred class. Packages are specified in Hudup property file. This method does not affect plug-in storage.
        Specified by:
        discover in interface PluginManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of returned instances.
        Parameters:
        referredClass - referred class. If this referred class is null, all classes are retrieved.
        Returns:
        list of instances belonging referred class.

      • discover

        public <T> java.util.List<T> discover(xURI storeUri,
                                      java.lang.Class<T> referredClass)
        Description copied from interface: PluginManager
        Getting a list of instances from store and referred class. Packages specified in Hudup property file are not used because this method uses store URI. This method does not affect plug-in storage.
        Specified by:
        discover in interface PluginManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - object type.
        Parameters:
        storeUri - store URI. If this store URI is null, current directory is used.
        referredClass - referred class. If this referred class is null, all classes are retrieved.
        Returns:
        list of algorithms from store and referred class.

      • registerAlg

        public void registerAlg(Alg alg)
        Description copied from interface: PluginManager
        Registering the specified algorithm into respective register table of PluginStorage. For example, a recommendation algorithm will be added into recommender register table returned by PluginStorage.getNormalAlgReg().
        Specified by:
        registerAlg in interface PluginManager
        Parameters:
        alg - specified algorithm.
